page.title: 15FORD WESTFIELD FARM
page.content: FORD WESTFIELD FARM This farm shows a departure from the normal cropping pattern in the area,in that it specialises in the growing of vegetables of which a certain proportion are sold on the basis of "Pick Your Own". The croppung plan for this year shows 210 acres of grain,175 acres of grass and 110 acres of vegetables such as potatoes,carrots,swedes,peas,onions, cauliflowers,cabbages,and beetroot. Carrots are sent for freezing,peas are compounded into animal feed,swedes are used for feeding sheep,wheat is part milled and part used for animal feed and spring barley is grown on contract for seed. Vegetables,especially potatoes,are irrigated with river water in dry weather.
